item.title: Cell Phone Tax Moratorium Act of 2007

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law.

item.title: Cell Phone Tax Moratorium Act of 2007

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.title: Mobile Wireless Tax Fairness Act of 2008

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance. (text of measure as introduced: CR S6571-6572)

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law.
Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text: Cell Tax Fairness Act of 2008 - Prohibits states or local governments from imposing any new discriminatory tax on mobile services, mobile service providers, or mobile service property for five years after the enactment of this Act. Defines "new discriminatory tax" as a tax imposed on mobile services, providers, or property that is not generally imposed on other types of services or property, or that is generally imposed at a lower rate.

item.title: To restrict any State or local jurisdiction from imposing a new discriminatory tax on cell phone services, providers, or property.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
